title.rendered: Make A Mobile Publisher App for Communities Hands-on Virtual Workshop

content.rendered:
Overview

This virtual workshop was to learn how to build rich digital experiences for your partners using External Apps, enabling them to collaborate on data and processes that live both inside and outside of Salesforce. Then publish that experience to the web and to the App Store or Google Play and as a pixel perfect native mobile app, boosting engagement and adoption from anywhere. No coding required!Today more than ever people work from any and every where, but also want to be CONNECTED everywhere.  That’s where when building a community, Mobile Publisher comes in.

As the company – you keep your look, your feel, your branding, and as the end user, you never miss a beat and always stay connected, with an experience that isn’t a 180 that has to be re-figured out.As the person building, you get to give a pixel perfect match for the mobile experience on both Android and iOS with changes instantly being on both, no crazy different security, minimal time (just think we’ll be set in just over an hour and many will be creating their first mobile app(s), and the best part… NO CODING!That’s right you don’t need the Android SDK tools, or any code for iPhone either, 100% declarative. Everything is built on platform so it’s what you know… BOOM!

Setup

For this exercise the scratch orgs will be provided for you with all the things you need for your community and for the Mobile Publisher for Communities in Salesforce.  You just need to bring your laptop and either a phone or tablet to this virtual meeting. If you could try to install the phone “Playgroud App” in advance, that would be awesome, but I can help you during the event if you have questions or get stuck.

iOS (iPhone/iPad)
You have 2 apps to install, I have tested this on my iPad, so again, I can help you through this if needed, don’t worry – and i LOVE questionsInstall the Apple TestFlight app from the App Store onto each test device.Install the Playground app from Apple TestFlight


Apple TestFlight Install

TestFlight Playground Install

Android

I too have an android phone and love playing with this, just let me know if you need anything or have questions.Download and install the app from Google Play


Install Android Playground App

Getting Building
You will receive the quip doc with the instructions we will go through together for the Workshop and any necessary branding icons will be sent in advance as well.  You will also have the trailheads and other shared info on Mobile Publisher (for Salesforce and Communities) sent out at the end and shared during the call.Here is the quip doc for the meetingHere is the link to get a scratch org to get started!


Read Quip Doc

Scratch Org

Resources


Video


View Video


View Event



Presenter Meighan Brodkey

Salesforce MVP and Technical Architect then Technical Architect that also Manages the Architecture Practice. Meighan went from admin to architect, taking the long path, and enjoyed the whole trip, gaining from the experiences and uses the admin, consultant, and prior in house life the better model projects from solution to deployment. Blogger – meighanrockssf.com, World Traveler for Salesforce – presented at Surf Force, North Africa Dreamin, YeurDreamin and more.

Saught admins and devs in the West Bank in 2017, 7x Dreamforce speaker, co-host of Salesforce Developer Podcast System Dot Debug, Ohana Slack admin & co-founder (learn about OhanaSlack here and sign up here).

Twitter

Then publish that experience to the web and to the App Store or Google Play and as a pixel perfect native mobile app, boosting engagement and adoption from anywhere. No coding required!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Ideas
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Salesforce IdeasThe IdeaExchange was designed so that we would have the opportunity to share what we, as the end users of Salesforce, the people that use it everyday, want and need as features and functionality.It's awesome. It's one of the most amazing, dare I even say revolutionary opportunities that we…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey Community Non-Account Based Sharing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups. Meighan takes the standard "Rollup" mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record. An awesome scenario that can show you how to take your automation to the…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Conga Composer
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Conga Composer is not only an amazing app for your Salesforce org, but it is an amazing company with customer service that will blow your mind.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Virtual Dreamin 20
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join Kenton san Miguel and Me when we present at Virtual Dreamin when we present on Community Cloud with our session, Control the Storm: Become a Lightning Community Master!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Welly User Group: Community Cloud Expert
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a…
